name: Development Workflow: Iyalcomers
description: Master the complete end-to-end development lifecycle at Iyalcomers. This deck covers key roles, processes, and tools from ticket reception to production deployment.

sentenceParts.prefix: As the Product Owner, Camila's primary responsibility is to

options.text: represent the business needs and define features
review and approve all Pull Requests
deploy PL/SQL packages to the UAT database

cards.correctAnswer: As the Product Owner, Camila's primary responsibility is to represent the business needs and define features.
cards.hint: She is the bridge between the business side and the technical team.

content.value:
The [Product Owner] is the voice of the business. Camila defines the 'what' and 'why' of a feature.

~Sebastian, the Tech Lead,~ reviews code, while ~Laura, the DBA,~ handles database deployments.

sentenceParts.prefix: Sebastian, the Tech Lead, is the owner of the Bitbucket repository and must

options.text: review and approve all Pull Requests before they are merged
schedule all project meetings and take notes
perform manual testing on the UAT environment

cards.correctAnswer: Sebastian, the Tech Lead, is the owner of the Bitbucket repository and must review and approve all Pull Requests before they are merged.
cards.hint: His role is to ensure code quality and maintain standards.

content.value:
The [Tech Lead] acts as the gatekeeper for the codebase. No code gets merged without his approval.

~Maria~ is the Project Coordinator who schedules meetings, and the ~Manual QA Testers~ handle UAT testing.

sentenceParts.prefix: Who is responsible for organizing meetings, documenting decisions, and ensuring smooth communication flow?

options.text: Maria, the Project Coordinator
Alonso, the Developer
Camila, the Product Owner

cards.correctAnswer: Who is responsible for organizing meetings, documenting decisions, and ensuring smooth communication flow? Maria, the Project Coordinator
cards.hint: This person is described as the 'glue that holds the process together'.

content.value:
[Maria, the Project Coordinator,] handles all administrative and communication tasks to keep the project on track.

While ~Alonso~ and ~Camila~ participate, Maria is the one who facilitates the process.

sentenceParts.prefix: The 'Purple' team is the operations group responsible for deployments. Laura, the DBA, specifically handles

options.text: running SQL scripts and deploying PL/SQL packages
loading .ildt files into the ISG repository
uploading the final binaries to the app stores

cards.correctAnswer: The 'Purple' team is the operations group responsible for deployments. Laura, the DBA, specifically handles running SQL scripts and deploying PL/SQL packages.
cards.hint: Her role is focused on the Database Tier.

content.value:
As the [Database Administrator (DBA)], Laura has exclusive access to run scripts on the UAT and PROD databases.

~David, the Middleware Admin,~ handles ISG files. The final app store upload happens after all deployments are done.

sentenceParts.prefix: David, the Middleware Administrator, is the ISG specialist on the 'Purple' team. His task is to

options.text: deploy the .ildt files to the Application Tier
write the ISG annotations in the .pks file
test the API endpoints from the Flutter application

cards.correctAnswer: David, the Middleware Administrator, is the ISG specialist on the 'Purple' team. His task is to deploy the .ildt files to the Application Tier.
cards.hint: His focus is on the integration layer, not the database or the front-end.

content.value:
[David's role] is to manage the Integrated SOA Gateway on the Application Tier, which involves loading the interface definition files (.ildt).

~Alonso, the developer,~ writes the annotations. The ~QA Testers~ would test the full flow.

sentenceParts.prefix: The development workflow is initiated when Alonso receives a requirement via

options.text: email
a Bitbucket ticket
a Teams message

cards.correctAnswer: The development workflow is initiated when Alonso receives a requirement via email.
cards.hint: This is the first step mentioned in 'The Lifecycle of a Request'.

content.value:
The process officially starts with an [email] to alonso.miranda@iyalcomers.com.

While ~Bitbucket~ and ~Teams~ are used later, the initial trigger is a formal email.

sentenceParts.prefix: After a requirement email is received, Maria schedules a kickoff meeting. Who are the mandatory attendees?

options.text: Maria, Alonso, and Camila
Alonso, Sebastian, and the 'Purple' team
Camila and the Business Stakeholders

cards.correctAnswer: After a requirement email is received, Maria schedules a kickoff meeting. Who are the mandatory attendees? Maria, Alonso, and Camila
cards.hint: Think about the core team needed to define and understand the task.

content.value:
The core group for defining a task is the [Project Coordinator (Maria), Developer (Alonso), and Product Owner (Camila)].

~Sebastian~ gets involved at the code review stage. ~Business Stakeholders~ are only invited for major features.

sentenceParts.prefix: What is the first action Alonso must take in the code repository before starting development work?

options.text: Create a new branch in Bitbucket
Create a Pull Request
Merge his code into the main branch

cards.correctAnswer: What is the first action Alonso must take in the code repository before starting development work? Create a new branch in Bitbucket
cards.hint: This isolates his new work from the stable codebase.

content.value:
Following best practices, all new development starts by [creating a new branch].

A ~Pull Request~ is created *after* the work is done. ~Merging~ happens only after the PR is approved.

sentenceParts.prefix: Once development is complete and Camila has given informal approval, Alonso creates a

options.text: Pull Request in Bitbucket
deployment ticket for the 'Purple' team
new Excel file for QA testing

cards.correctAnswer: Once development is complete and Camila has given informal approval, Alonso creates a Pull Request in Bitbucket and assigns it to Sebastian.
cards.hint: This is the formal process to request a code review.

content.value:
A [Pull Request (PR)] is the mechanism to propose changes and ask the Tech Lead to review the code.

The ~deployment ticket~ is created after the PR is approved and merged. The ~Excel file~ is created by the QA team.

sentenceParts.prefix: Alonso cannot merge his branch into the main development branch until

options.text: Sebastian (Tech Lead) approves the Pull Request
Camila (Product Owner) approves the feature
the QA Testers complete their functional testing

cards.correctAnswer: Alonso cannot merge his branch into the main development branch until Sebastian (Tech Lead) approves the Pull Request.
cards.hint: The Tech Lead is the gatekeeper of the repository.

content.value:
[Sebastian's approval on the PR] is the mandatory step that unlocks the ability to merge the code.

~Camila's approval~ is for the feature's functionality, while ~QA testing~ happens in UAT, after the code is already merged.

sentenceParts.prefix: After the PR is approved and merged, Alonso prepares a deployment package and emails it to the

options.text: 'Purple' team's distribution list
Manual QA Testers directly
Business Stakeholders for final review

cards.correctAnswer: After the PR is approved and merged, Alonso prepares a deployment package and emails it to the 'Purple' team's distribution list.
cards.hint: This is the formal handoff from Development to Operations.

content.value:
The deployment request is sent to the ['Purple' team], which consists of the DBA and Middleware Admin who will perform the UAT deployment.

~QA Testers~ are notified *after* the deployment is complete. ~Stakeholders~ are not involved in this technical step.

sentenceParts.prefix: During UAT deployment, Laura (DBA) and David (Middleware Admin) work on

options.text: different application tiers simultaneously
the same tier, but one after the other
only the Database Tier

cards.correctAnswer: During UAT deployment, Laura (DBA) and David (Middleware Admin) work on different application tiers simultaneously.
cards.hint: The text mentions their tasks happen 'simultaneously'.

content.value:
Laura deploys to the [Database Tier] while David deploys to the [Application Tier]. These tasks can happen in parallel.

They do not work on the ~same tier~, and David's work on the ~Application Tier~ is essential.

sentenceParts.prefix: How do the Manual QA Testers perform their work?

options.text: By using the app like a real customer, without code
By running automated test scripts
By reviewing the source code in Bitbucket

cards.correctAnswer: How do the Manual QA Testers perform their work? By using the app like a real customer, without code
cards.hint: Their role is described as 'non-technical'.

content.value:
[Manual QA Testers] perform functional, black-box testing. They test the full user flow to find real-world issues.

The process described does not involve ~automated scripts~, and they do not ~review the code~.

sentenceParts.prefix: Where are the findings from the Manual QA Testers documented?

options.text: In a new Excel file on OneDrive
In a Bitbucket ticket
In an email to Alonso

cards.correctAnswer: Where are the findings from the Manual QA Testers documented? In a new Excel file on OneDrive
cards.hint: The document has specific columns like Section, Error Description, etc.

content.value:
All testing results are formally documented in a dedicated [Excel file for that release], stored centrally on OneDrive.

A ~Bitbucket ticket~ isn't mentioned for QA findings, and an ~email~ would be informal. The Excel file is the official record.

sentenceParts.prefix: If the QA team finds a bug, they share the Excel link with Maria, who then

options.text: schedules a follow-up meeting and a new 'FIX' ticket is created
assigns the bug directly to Alonso in Bitbucket
asks the 'Purple' team to roll back the deployment

cards.correctAnswer: If the QA team finds a bug, they share the Excel link with Maria, who then schedules a follow-up meeting and a new 'FIX' ticket is created.
cards.hint: Maria's role is to coordinate the response to any issues found.

content.value:
The [feedback loop] is managed by Maria. She facilitates communication to ensure the bug is reviewed and a new work item is created for Alonso.

There is no ~direct assignment~ in Bitbucket, and a ~rollback~ would only be for a catastrophic failure.

sentenceParts.prefix: The 'Purple' team receives the final 'green light' to deploy to Production after

options.text: the QA testers give their official sign-off to Maria and Camila
Sebastian approves the final code review
the Business Stakeholders approve the UAT demo

cards.correctAnswer: The 'Purple' team receives the final 'green light' to deploy to Production after the QA testers give their official sign-off to Maria and Camila.
cards.hint: Production deployment can only happen after successful UAT testing.

content.value:
The [official sign-off from the QA team] is the final quality gate before the feature can go live.

~Sebastian's code review~ happens much earlier. ~Stakeholder approval~ may be needed, but the QA sign-off is the direct trigger for deployment.

sentenceParts.prefix: In this workflow, the UAT environment serves as a

options.text: stable testing ground for non-technical users before production
personal development and testing server for Alonso
live environment for real customers

cards.correctAnswer: In this workflow, the UAT environment serves as a stable testing ground for non-technical users before production.
cards.hint: What does UAT stand for?

content.value:
[UAT stands for User Acceptance Testing]. It's where the Manual QA Testers validate the feature before it's released.

Alonso works on a ~DEV environment~, and the ~PROD environment~ is for real customers.

sentenceParts.prefix: The three distinct technical layers Alonso works on are the Flutter Presentation Layer, the PL/SQL Layers, and the

options.text: ISG integration on the Application Tier
Manual QA testing process
Bitbucket repository management

cards.correctAnswer: The three distinct technical layers Alonso works on are the Flutter Presentation Layer, the PL/SQL Layers, and the ISG integration on the Application Tier.
cards.hint: This relates to the 3-Tier Architecture concept.

content.value:
Alonso's work spans the full stack: [Presentation (Flutter), Business/Data (PL/SQL), and Application (ISG)].

~QA testing~ and ~repository management~ are part of the workflow, but they are not technical development layers.

sentenceParts.prefix: The Business Stakeholders are described as 'big fish' who

options.text: ensure the project aligns with strategic goals
participate in daily development work
write the initial requirement emails

cards.correctAnswer: The Business Stakeholders are described as 'big fish' who ensure the project aligns with strategic goals.
cards.hint: They are involved at a high level, not in the day-to-day details.

content.value:
[Business Stakeholders] provide high-level vision and may join key meetings to see progress.

They do not get involved in ~daily work~, and the requirement emails in this workflow come from various business users, not necessarily the stakeholders.

sentenceParts.prefix: What is the purpose of Maria sharing her screen and taking live notes during meetings?

options.text: To ensure everyone is aligned and agrees on the decisions being made
To allow Sebastian to review the code during the meeting
To create the final user documentation for the application

cards.correctAnswer: What is the purpose of Maria sharing her screen and taking live notes during meetings? To ensure everyone is aligned and agrees on the decisions being made
cards.hint: This practice helps avoid misunderstandings.

content.value:
[Live note-taking and the subsequent summary email] create a shared understanding and an official record of the meeting's outcomes.

~Code reviews~ happen in Bitbucket, not during requirements meetings. ~User documentation~ is a separate process.

sentenceParts.prefix: During development, Alonso shares screenshots and test builds with Camila for

options.text: informal feedback
official sign-off
code quality review

cards.correctAnswer: During development, Alonso shares screenshots and test builds with Camila for informal feedback.
cards.hint: This is a quick check-in before the formal review process begins.

content.value:
This [informal review loop] with the Product Owner helps ensure the development is on the right track before committing to a formal Pull Request.

~Official sign-off~ comes from QA, and the ~code review~ is done by Sebastian.

sentenceParts.prefix: The deployment package Alonso sends to the 'Purple' team contains the SQL scripts, the .ildt file, and the

options.text: .apk/.ipa binaries
source code branch
QA testing Excel file

cards.correctAnswer: The deployment package Alonso sends to the 'Purple' team contains the SQL scripts, the .ildt file, and the .apk/.ipa binaries.
cards.hint: What is the final output for the mobile application itself?

content.value:
The package must contain all deployable artifacts: database changes (SQL), middleware changes (.ildt), and the compiled application itself ([.apk for Android, .ipa for iOS]).

The ~source code~ is in Bitbucket, and the ~QA file~ is for testing results.

sentenceParts.prefix: The columns in the QA Excel file include 'Error Description', 'Expected Behavior', and

options.text: User Account Used
Developer Assigned
Deployment Date

cards.correctAnswer: The columns in the QA Excel file include 'Error Description', 'Expected Behavior', and User Account Used.
cards.hint: This helps developers reproduce the bug exactly as the tester saw it.

content.value:
Documenting the [User Account Used] is crucial for debugging, especially if issues are related to user-specific data or permissions.

~Developer Assigned~ would be part of a later ticketing process, and the ~Deployment Date~ would be tracked by Maria.

sentenceParts.prefix: The final step of the go-live process, after the PROD deployments are complete, is to

options.text: upload the final binaries to the app stores
delete the development branch from Bitbucket
send a final summary email to stakeholders

cards.correctAnswer: The final step of the go-live process, after the PROD deployments are complete, is to upload the final binaries to the app stores.
cards.hint: How do the end-users get the new version of the app?

content.value:
The process is not complete until the [application is made available to customers] via the official app stores.

~Branch cleanup~ and ~communication~ are good practices but are secondary to the actual release of the software.

sentenceParts.prefix: The UAT deployment request email represents a formal handoff from the

options.text: Development to the Operations
Quality Assurance to the Business
Product Owner to the Development

cards.correctAnswer: The UAT deployment request email represents a formal handoff from the Development to the Operations domains.
cards.hint: Think about who creates the package versus who deploys it.

content.value:
This email is a critical handoff. [Alonso (Development)] has finished his work, and now the ['Purple' team (Operations)] takes responsibility for the deployment.

~QA to Business~ is the final sign-off. ~Product Owner to Development~ is the requirements handoff at the very beginning of the process.

sentenceParts.prefix: Which team is composed of non-technical staff who test from a user's perspective?

options.text: The Manual QA Testers
The 'Purple' Team
The Business Stakeholders

cards.correctAnswer: Which team is composed of non-technical staff who test from a user's perspective? The Manual QA Testers
cards.hint: Their job is to simulate real-world usage.

content.value:
The [Manual QA Testers] are responsible for User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and focus on functionality, not code.

The ['Purple' Team] is technical (DBA, Middleware), and ~Business Stakeholders~ provide high-level direction, they do not test.

sentenceParts.prefix: A Pull Request is a feature of which tool used at Iyalcomers?

options.text: Bitbucket
Microsoft Teams
OneDrive

cards.correctAnswer: A Pull Request is a feature of which tool used at Iyalcomers? Bitbucket
cards.hint: This tool is used for code management and version control.

content.value:
[Bitbucket] is a Git-based source code repository hosting service where developers collaborate and review code via Pull Requests.

~Teams~ is for communication, and ~OneDrive~ is for file storage.

sentenceParts.prefix: The deployment process for Production is a repeat of the UAT process, performed by

options.text: Laura and David
Alonso
Sebastian

cards.correctAnswer: The deployment process for Production is a repeat of the UAT process, performed by Laura and David.
cards.hint: The same specialists handle both pre-production and live environments.

content.value:
[Laura (DBA) and David (Middleware Admin)] are the members of the 'Purple' team responsible for all deployments, ensuring consistency between UAT and PROD.

~Alonso's~ role is to provide the package, and ~Sebastian's~ is to approve the code.

sentenceParts.prefix: The .pks file, where ISG annotations are written, is part of the

options.text: PL/SQL Business Logic/Data Access
Flutter Presentation
Application Tier Deployment

cards.correctAnswer: The .pks file, where ISG annotations are written, is part of the PL/SQL Business Logic/Data Access layer.
cards.hint: .pks files contain the specification for a PL/SQL package.

content.value:
The annotations are special comments added directly to the [PL/SQL package specification (.pks) file] to define the web service contract.

It is not part of the ~Flutter code~, and it is the *source* for the ~.ildt file~ used in the deployment.

sentenceParts.prefix: Who provides the final approval that allows Maria to give the 'green light' for Production deployment?

options.text: The Manual QA Testers and Camila
Sebastian, the Tech Lead
The Business Stakeholders

cards.correctAnswer: Who provides the final approval that allows Maria to give the 'green light' for Production deployment? The Manual QA Testers and Camila
cards.hint: The approval comes from both the testing team and the business representative.

content.value:
The process requires sign-off from both the [QA team (confirming it works)] and the [Product Owner (confirming it meets requirements)].

~Sebastian's~ approval happened before UAT. ~Stakeholders~ are not involved in the final go/no-go decision.

sentenceParts.prefix: The primary purpose of creating a new branch for each task is to

options.text: isolate new code and prevent destabilizing the main branch
archive old code that is no longer in use
document the business requirements for the feature

cards.correctAnswer: The primary purpose of creating a new branch for each task is to isolate new code and prevent destabilizing the main branch.
cards.hint: This is a core principle of version control systems like Git.

content.value:
[Branching] allows developers to work on features or fixes in a contained environment without affecting the stable, shared codebase.

~Archiving code~ is typically done with tags or by removing it, not by creating active branches. ~Requirements~ are documented by Maria in separate documents.

sentenceParts.prefix: Sebastian's code review focuses on quality and standards, not on

options.text: verifying the feature meets every business requirement
checking for potential performance issues
ensuring the code follows team conventions

cards.correctAnswer: Sebastian's code review focuses on quality and standards, not on verifying the feature meets every business requirement.
cards.hint: Whose role is it to represent the business needs?

content.value:
A [Tech Lead's code review] is about technical excellence. It's ~Camila's (the PO)~ job to confirm the functionality meets the business needs.

Checking for ~performance issues~ and ~following conventions~ are key parts of a technical code review.

sentenceParts.prefix: The difference between the DEV and UAT environments is that DEV is for the developer's work, while UAT is for

options.text: formal testing by a separate QA team
the final, live version used by customers
storing the project's source code

cards.correctAnswer: The difference between the DEV and UAT environments is that DEV is for the developer's work, while UAT is for formal testing by a separate QA team.
cards.hint: UAT stands for User Acceptance Testing.

content.value:
The [UAT environment] is a stable, controlled replica of production used to validate a feature before release.

The ~live version~ is the PROD environment. The ~source code~ is stored in Bitbucket, not an application environment.

sentenceParts.prefix: The `User Account Used` column in the QA Excel sheet is crucial for

options.text: helping the developer reproduce the bug
calculating the total time spent testing
assigning blame for the error

cards.correctAnswer: The `User Account Used` column in the QA Excel sheet is crucial for helping the developer reproduce the bug.
cards.hint: Bugs can often be related to specific user data or permissions.

content.value:
To fix a bug, a developer must first see it happen. Knowing the [exact test account] makes reproducing the issue much easier.

Bug tracking is about ~fixing the product~, not blaming individuals or tracking time in this specific manner.

sentenceParts.prefix: A key responsibility of the 'Purple' team (DBA and Middleware) is to

options.text: ensure deployments are consistent between UAT and PROD
write the application code for new features
define the strategic goals for the business

cards.correctAnswer: A key responsibility of the 'Purple' team (DBA and Middleware) is to ensure deployments are consistent between UAT and PROD.
cards.hint: They repeat the same deployment process for both environments.

content.value:
The [Operations team] owns the deployment process. Their consistency ensures that what was tested in UAT is exactly what goes live in PROD.

~Alonso~ writes the code, and the ~Business Stakeholders~ define strategic goals.

sentenceParts.prefix: The ISG annotations in the .pks file serve as

options.text: a blueprint for generating the web service definition
the executable code for the Flutter application
a security certificate for the database

cards.correctAnswer: The ISG annotations in the .pks file serve as a blueprint for generating the web service definition.
cards.hint: These annotations are metadata that describe the API.

content.value:
[Annotations] are machine-readable comments that tools use to generate the actual .ildt deployment file. They define the API contract.

~Flutter code~ is written in Dart. ~Security certificates~ are a separate concept related to network security.

sentenceParts.prefix: If Sebastian requests changes in a Pull Request, Alonso must

options.text: make the code changes and push to the same branch
create a new, separate Pull Request for the fixes
ask Maria to override the Tech Lead's decision

cards.correctAnswer: If Sebastian requests changes in a Pull Request, Alonso must make the code changes and push to the same branch.
cards.hint: The Pull Request is a living discussion about a specific branch.

content.value:
The standard workflow is to [update the existing branch with new commits]. The Pull Request will automatically show the new changes for Sebastian to re-review.

A ~new PR~ would be confusing, and ~overriding the Tech Lead~ is not part of a healthy review process.

sentenceParts.prefix: Storing the QA findings on a shared OneDrive ensures the document is

options.text: a single, centralized source of truth for the test results
automatically backed up to the Bitbucket repository
only visible to the QA testers and no one else

cards.correctAnswer: Storing the QA findings on a shared OneDrive ensures the document is a single, centralized source of truth for the test results.
cards.hint: Why use a shared drive instead of local files?

content.value:
[Using a cloud storage solution like OneDrive] prevents version conflicts and ensures everyone (Maria, Camila, Alonso) is looking at the same, up-to-date information.

~Bitbucket~ is for code, not test results. The document needs to be ~shared~ with the team, not kept private.

sentenceParts.prefix: Alonso, as the Developer, interacts with the Database Tier primarily by

options.text: writing PL/SQL code that will be deployed by the DBA
running SQL scripts directly on the PROD database
managing database user accounts and permissions

cards.correctAnswer: Alonso, as the Developer, interacts with the Database Tier primarily by writing PL/SQL code that will be deployed by the DBA.
cards.hint: Consider the separation of duties between development and operations.

content.value:
The developer's role is to [create the database logic]. The DBA's role is to manage and deploy to the database environments.

Running scripts directly on ~PROD~ is strictly forbidden for developers. Managing ~user accounts~ is also a DBA function.

sentenceParts.prefix: The 'informal review' with Camila is important because it

options.text: provides early feedback and can prevent wasted effort
replaces the need for a formal code review by Sebastian
gives the final approval for production deployment

cards.correctAnswer: The 'informal review' with Camila is important because it provides early feedback and can prevent wasted effort.
cards.hint: It's better to find out you're going in the wrong direction early.

content.value:
This quick check-in acts as a [course correction], ensuring the developer's interpretation matches the Product Owner's vision before too much code is written.

It is not a substitute for the ~technical code review~ or the ~final QA sign-off~.

sentenceParts.prefix: In this workflow, Microsoft Teams is used as a tool for

options.text: real-time collaboration and meetings
long-term storage of official source code
deploying applications to the UAT server

cards.correctAnswer: In this workflow, Microsoft Teams is used as a tool for real-time collaboration and meetings.
cards.hint: Maria uses it to schedule and host discussions.

content.value:
[Teams] is the chosen platform for synchronous communication, like the kickoff and bug review meetings.

~Source code~ lives in Bitbucket. ~Deployments~ are handled by the 'Purple' team using specific tools.

sentenceParts.prefix: If the QA testers find no major issues, their next step is to

options.text: provide their official sign-off to Maria and Camila
deploy the application to the PROD environment themselves
write the release notes for the app store

cards.correctAnswer: If the QA testers find no major issues, their next step is to provide their official sign-off to Maria and Camila.
cards.hint: Their role is to validate, not to deploy.

content.value:
The [QA sign-off] is the formal conclusion of the testing phase, signaling that the feature is ready for release from a quality perspective.

~Deployments~ are the 'Purple' team's job. ~Release notes~ would likely be written by Camila or a marketing team.

sentenceParts.prefix: The overall development process at Iyalcomers can be described as

options.text: a structured, multi-phase workflow with clear roles
an unstructured process where developers work independently
a fully automated process with no human intervention

cards.correctAnswer: The overall development process at Iyalcomers can be described as a structured, multi-phase workflow with clear roles.
cards.hint: Consider the handoffs between Alonso, Sebastian, Maria, and the 'Purple' team.

content.value:
The process has [distinct phases] (Analysis, Dev, Review, Deploy, Test) and well-defined responsibilities for each person involved.

It is the opposite of an ~unstructured~ or ~fully automated~ system, relying heavily on collaboration and specific human checkpoints.

sentenceParts.prefix: What is the relationship between Maria (Project Coordinator) and Camila (Product Owner)?

options.text: They collaborate: Maria facilitates the process, Camila defines the content
Maria reports directly to Camila
They have the same role and responsibilities

cards.correctAnswer: What is the relationship between Maria (Project Coordinator) and Camila (Product Owner)? They collaborate: Maria facilitates the process, Camila defines the content
cards.hint: One is focused on 'how' the team works, the other on 'what' the team builds.

content.value:
[Maria] manages the logistics and communication (the process), while [Camila] manages the feature requirements (the product). They are peers with different focuses.

The document doesn't specify a ~reporting structure~, and their roles are ~distinctly different~.

sentenceParts.prefix: The term 'binaries' in the context of the .apk/.ipa files refers to

options.text: the compiled, executable version of the application
the human-readable source code files
configuration text files

cards.correctAnswer: The term 'binaries' in the context of the .apk/.ipa files refers to the compiled, executable version of the application.
cards.hint: This is the format that a mobile device can actually run.

content.value:
[Binaries] are the output of the compilation process, where source code is converted into machine code that the operating system can execute.

This is distinct from the ~source code~ (e.g., Dart files) which developers write.

sentenceParts.prefix: A 'FIX' ticket is created in response to

options.text: a bug found by the QA team during UAT
a new feature request from the business
a Pull Request being rejected by the Tech Lead

cards.correctAnswer: A 'FIX' ticket is created in response to a bug found by the QA team during UAT.
cards.hint: This ticket represents unplanned work to correct an issue.

content.value:
The workflow specifies that if the [Excel file from QA contains issues], it leads to the creation of a 'FIX' ticket for Alonso.

A ~new feature request~ would start the whole process over. A ~rejected PR~ is handled within the PR itself, not with a new ticket.

sentenceParts.prefix: The relationship between the .pks file and the .ildt file is that the .pks is the source, and the .ildt is the

options.text: generated output used for deployment
manual backup of the .pks file
documentation for the .pks file

cards.correctAnswer: The relationship between the .pks file and the .ildt file is that the .pks is the source, and the .ildt is the generated output used for deployment.
cards.hint: One is human-readable (with annotations), the other is for a tool (ISG).

content.value:
Alonso writes annotations in the [PL/SQL package spec (.pks)], then a tool generates the [.ildt file]. David then deploys this generated file.

It is not a ~backup~ or ~documentation~, but a necessary artifact for the deployment process.

sentenceParts.prefix: In the Iyalcomers workflow, who holds the ultimate authority on code quality?

options.text: Sebastian, the Tech Lead
Camila, the Product Owner
The Manual QA Testers

cards.correctAnswer: In the Iyalcomers workflow, who holds the ultimate authority on code quality? Sebastian, the Tech Lead
cards.hint: This person's approval is required to merge any code.

content.value:
As the person who [reviews and approves all Pull Requests], Sebastian is the final arbiter of what constitutes acceptable code in the repository.

~Camila~ is the authority on feature functionality. The ~QA team~ is the authority on user experience and functional correctness.

sentenceParts.prefix: The purpose of the meeting summary email sent by Maria is to

options.text: provide a written record and prevent future disagreements
assign development tasks to Alonso
request funding for the project from stakeholders

cards.correctAnswer: The purpose of the meeting summary email sent by Maria is to provide a written record and prevent future disagreements.
cards.hint: It ensures everyone remembers the conversation the same way.

content.value:
The [summary email] acts as the official minutes of the meeting, creating alignment and a reference point for what was decided.

Task ~assignment~ happens organically in the meeting. ~Funding requests~ would be a separate, more formal process.

sentenceParts.prefix: The term 'Go-Live' refers to the moment when

options.text: the new feature becomes available to real users
Alonso starts writing the first line of code
the QA team starts their testing in UAT

cards.correctAnswer: The term 'Go-Live' refers to the moment when the new feature becomes available to real users.
cards.hint: This is the final milestone of the entire lifecycle.

content.value:
[Go-Live] is the culmination of the entire process, where the PROD deployment is complete and the app store listings are updated.

~Starting to code~ is the beginning of Phase 2. ~QA testing~ is Phase 5, but before production.

sentenceParts.prefix: A 'handoff' in this process, such as from Alonso to the 'Purple' team, is a critical point where

options.text: responsibility for a task is transferred
the project is considered complete
a new developer joins the team

cards.correctAnswer: A 'handoff' in this process, such as from Alonso to the 'Purple' team, is a critical point where responsibility for a task is transferred.
cards.hint: Think of a relay race.

content.value:
A [handoff] is a transfer of ownership. When Alonso sends the deployment package, the responsibility for deployment moves to Laura and David.

The ~project is not complete~ until after many more handoffs. It's not related to ~new team members~.

sentenceParts.prefix: What type of testing is NOT mentioned in the Iyalcomers workflow?

options.text: Automated unit or integration testing
Manual functional testing
User Acceptance Testing (UAT)

cards.correctAnswer: What type of testing is NOT mentioned in the Iyalcomers workflow? Automated unit or integration testing
cards.hint: The QA process is described as entirely manual.

content.value:
The described process relies exclusively on [Manual QA Testers] performing [UAT]. There is no mention of developers writing ~automated tests~ (like unit tests) for their code.

[Manual functional testing] is exactly what the QA team does.

sentenceParts.prefix: Deploying the .ildt file to the ISG repository has the effect of

options.text: publishing or updating the API endpoint
compiling the Flutter application
modifying data in the database tables

cards.correctAnswer: Deploying the .ildt file to the ISG repository has the effect of publishing or updating the API endpoint.
cards.hint: This makes the web service available to be called.

content.value:
The [.ildt file] contains the service definition. Loading it into ISG makes the web service discoverable and callable by client applications.

~Compiling Flutter~ produces an .apk/.ipa. ~Modifying data~ is done by running SQL scripts, which is Laura's job.

sentenceParts.prefix: A Pull Request serves as a form of documentation because it

options.text: shows the history of code changes and review comments
generates a user manual for the feature
is stored in the same place as the QA Excel files

cards.correctAnswer: A Pull Request serves as a form of documentation because it shows the history of code changes and review comments.
cards.hint: It tells the 'why' behind a code change.

content.value:
A well-written [Pull Request] provides context for a change. The discussion and review comments become a historical record that can be valuable for future developers.

It does not generate a ~user manual~ and is stored in ~Bitbucket~, not OneDrive.

sentenceParts.prefix: The term 'Full Stack' could be used to describe Alonso because he

options.text: works on the frontend, backend, and integration layers
manages the entire project from start to finish
is the only developer on the team

cards.correctAnswer: The term 'Full Stack' could be used to describe Alonso because he works on the frontend, backend, and integration layers.
cards.hint: His work covers the Presentation, Application, and Database-facing logic.

content.value:
A [Full Stack developer] has expertise across the different tiers of an application: [Flutter (frontend)], [PL/SQL (backend)], and [ISG (integration)].

~Maria~ manages the project. The document doesn't say if Alonso is the ~only developer~, just that he is the one in this story.

sentenceParts.prefix: If the QA team finds a bug, the development process

options.text: loops back to the development phase for a fix
is immediately halted and the project is cancelled
continues, and the bug is scheduled to be fixed in a future release

cards.correctAnswer: If the QA team finds a bug, the development process loops back to the development phase for a fix.
cards.hint: The feedback loop involves creating a 'FIX' ticket.

content.value:
Finding bugs in UAT is expected. The process is designed to handle this by creating a [new 'FIX' ticket for Alonso], effectively re-starting a mini-cycle of Dev -> Review -> Deploy.

~Cancelling the project~ is extreme. ~Ignoring the bug~ is not an option if the feature is to be released.

sentenceParts.prefix: The person who has the most holistic view of a feature's journey from idea to deployment is

options.text: Maria, the Project Coordinator
Alonso, the Developer
Laura, the DBA

cards.correctAnswer: The person who has the most holistic view of a feature's journey from idea to deployment is Maria, the Project Coordinator.
cards.hint: Who is involved at every single phase, from the first meeting to the final 'green light'?

content.value:
[Maria] is the common thread through the entire process. She schedules the initial meeting, is copied on the deployment request, notifies QA, and gives the final go-ahead.

~Alonso~ and ~Laura~ have very deep but focused involvement in specific phases.

sentenceParts.prefix: The 'separation of duties' is demonstrated by the rule that

options.text: only the DBA is authorized to run scripts on production
Alonso must create a new branch for every task
Camila defines the requirements for a feature

cards.correctAnswer: The 'separation of duties' is demonstrated by the rule that only the DBA is authorized to run scripts on production.
cards.hint: This is a key security and stability principle.

content.value:
[Separation of duties] means the person who writes the code (developer) is not the same person who deploys it to critical environments (DBA). This reduces risk.

~Branching~ is a version control best practice. ~Defining requirements~ is a product management function.

sentenceParts.prefix: After a successful production deployment, the process for the *next* feature

options.text: begins again at Phase 1 with a new requirement
is paused for a one-week 'cool down' period
is handled by a completely different team

cards.correctAnswer: After a successful production deployment, the process for the *next* feature begins again at Phase 1 with a new requirement.
cards.hint: The lifecycle is cyclical.

content.value:
This entire workflow describes a [continuous cycle of development]. As soon as one feature is live, the process can start over for the next prioritized item.

There is no mention of a ~cool down~ period, and the ~same core team~ would likely handle the next feature.

sentenceParts.prefix: Bitbucket is to source code as OneDrive is to

options.text: project documentation and test results
real-time team communication
application deployment packages

cards.correctAnswer: Bitbucket is to source code as OneDrive is to project documentation and test results.
cards.hint: Each tool is used for a different type of file or artifact.

content.value:
[Bitbucket] is a specialized tool for managing code. [OneDrive] is a general-purpose file storage solution, used here for the QA Excel file.

~Teams~ is used for communication. ~Deployment packages~ are sent via email in this workflow.
